subject: Marketing
title: Environmental Marketing Responsibility
description: A short lesson to help you apply Environmental Marketing Responsibility.

hook.text: Fast fashion brands sell 'eco collections' while producing 100 billion garments per year.

buildup.text: The fashion industry is the second-largest polluter globally, after oil and gas.

discovery.text: Environmental marketing creates expectations that must be backed by systemic change.

twist.text: A small eco line within a destructive business model is marketing, not environmentalism.

climax.text: Ethical environmental marketing requires transparency about both progress and remaining impact.

punchline.text: Small green steps matter. Claiming big green leaps doesn't.

quiz.question: Why are small eco collections from fast fashion brands ethically questionable?
options: They exist within a fundamentally destructive business model
Eco collections are always higher quality
Consumers prefer fast fashion over sustainable options
